TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ServiceInstallerDialogResult extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the return value of a form.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceProcess.Design.ServiceInstallerDialog.Result%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property uses this enumeration to indicate the user response to the dialog box.
## Examples The following example uses a <xref:System.ServiceProcess.Design.ServiceInstallerDialog> to prompt the user for a service installation account.
[!code-cpp[ServiceInstallConfig#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/ServiceInstallConfig/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[ServiceInstallConfig#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/ServiceInstallConfig/CS/source.cs#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceProcess.Design.ServiceInstallerDialogResult Canceled = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The dialog return value is . This value typically indicates that the user canceled out of the dialog without setting the account fields.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceProcess.Design.ServiceInstallerDialogResult OK = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The dialog return value is . This value typically indicates that the user confirmed the account properties and pressed the button to close the dialog.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceProcess.Design.ServiceInstallerDialogResult UseSystem = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Install the service with a system account rather than a user account. This value typically indicates that the dialog was not displayed to the user. For example, the property is set to something other than .
